title: Police: 13-year-old boy trespassing at JBLM shot in face
content:
JOINT BASE LEWIS MCCHORD, Wash. -- A 13-year-old boy was wounded while trespassing with two others on the JBLM base, Lakewood police said.
The three teens -- the 13-year-old victim, along with a 14-year-old and a 17-year-old, went through a hole in the fence onto JBLM property in the woods near 150th St. SW and Woodbrook Drive South, according to Lakewood police.
Police say the 17-year-old had a handgun that "discharged" and hit the victim in the face.
The wounded teen was rushed to Mary Bridge Hospital in Tacoma in serious to critical condition, according to West Pierce Fire & Rescue officials.
Police are interviewing the alleged shooter, but so far it unclear if the shooting was accidental or on purpose.
Residents in the area heard the gunshot and were shocked to hear the victim is so young.
"It's messed up, because he's 13. I've lost 12-year-old cousins, 11-year-old cousins, it's messed up. I feel for the family. That's too young," one neighbor said.
Lakewood police are investigating the incident jointly with the Federal Bureau of Investigation, which is the agency responsible for civilian crimes on federal property.
